titleStmt.title: Examples are not Enough, Learn to Criticize! Criticism for Interpretability

analytic.title: Examples are not Enough, Learn to Criticize! Criticism for Interpretability

abstract.p: Example-based explanations are widely used in the effort to improve the inter-pretability of highly complex distributions. However, prototypes alone are rarely sufficient to represent the gist of the complexity. In order for users to construct better mental models and understand complex data distributions, we also need criticism to explain what are not captured by prototypes. Motivated by the Bayesian model criticism framework, we develop MMD-critic which efficiently learns prototypes and criticism, designed to aid human interpretability. A human subject pilot study shows that the MMD-critic selects prototypes and criticism that are useful to facilitate human understanding and reasoning. We also evaluate the prototypes selected by MMD-critic via a nearest prototype classifier, showing competitive performance compared to baselines.
